definition: to pull out/to pull a lever
to pull/to turn (sth) around/to turn around (a situation)/to recoup
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: In transformational language, flipping the switch “causes” the light to turn on.
sentences.chinese: 用轉換的語言說，扳動開關“造成”了燈亮。

sentences.english: There was a click as the hunter cocked his rifle .
sentences.chinese: 咔嗒一聲，獵人扳動了槍機。

sentences.english: Campana slammed on the train's brake and blasted his air horn.
sentences.chinese: 坎帕納猛地扳動火車剎車，拉響了警報器。

sentences.english: The main strap can be tightened with a pretty simple tug on the inside lever.
sentences.chinese: 主要的束帶可以藉由簡單的扳動中央撥杆來束緊。

sentences.english: At the same moment, he pressed the trigger of his rifle. The flame leaped forth.
sentences.chinese: 同時他扳動卡賓槍的扳機，噴出了一道閃光。

sentences.english: If still invalid, can throw decompression, make the engine flameout lever decompression.
sentences.chinese: 若仍無效，可扳動減壓拉桿減壓，使發動機熄火。

sentences.english: In addition, the cover of the mobile phone is also provided with a pulling plate and a blocking plate.
sentences.chinese: 此外，手機套的蓋體還設有扳動片及擋片。

sentences.english: He reached for his empty gun , aimed, and pulled the trigger.
sentences.chinese: 他伸手摸到那支空槍，瞄準了，扳動槍機。

sentences.english: You should not be able to move the motor in the base when the locking lever is clamped.
sentences.chinese: 鎖定杆不用太過使勁就可以扳動，太用力會損壞底座。

sentences.english: He fired but his pistol failed to go off.
sentences.chinese: 他扳動了扳機，但手槍沒有發射。

sentences.english: Peter aimed the gun at the bird, but did not fire.
sentences.chinese: 他伸手摸到那支空槍，瞄準了，扳動槍機。

sentences.english: You should be able to clamp the locking lever without excessive force. Excessive force may damage the base.
sentences.chinese: 鎖定杆不用太過使勁就可以扳動，太用力會損壞底座。
